intro: Ivesia setosa, commonly known as the slender ivesia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It belongs to the Rosaceae family, which includes roses and other related species. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pink flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are typically narrow and hairy, adapted to thrive in rocky or arid environments. Ivesia setosa is often found in open habitats such as meadows and slopes, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local pollinators.
